intro: Pleiospermium annamense, commonly known as the Annam pleiosperm, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its woody stems and palmate leaves. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically yellow or greenish in color. It is often found in moist, shaded environments such as mountain forests. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
